Tuntutan KPK Tak Mempan untuk Sofyan
04 Nov 2019, 21:03 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Kedua tangan Sofyan Basir menengadah seraya memanjatkan doa. Vonis bebas dari ketokan palu hakimlah yang memang Sofyan damba.
"Sekali lagi saya bersyukur kepada Allah, kepada pemerintah, dan semua pihak yang membantu proses ini sehingga bebas," kata Sofyan selepas pembacaan vonis padanya.
Mantan Direktur Utama PT PLN itu lolos dari tuntutan jaksa KPK. Dalam lembar tuntutan tersebut, jaksa meminta majelis hakim menghukum Sofyan dengan pidana 5 tahun penjara dan denda Rp 200 juta subsider 3 bulan kurungan.
Bebasnya Sofyan membuat jaksa terperangah. Namun kesempatan untuk mengajukan banding atas vonis itu tetap membuat jaksa istikamah.
"Yang jelas kami mempelajari putusan hakim dulu baru menyatakan sikap," kata Ronald Ferdinand Worotikan sebagai salah satu jaksa yang bertugas dalam persidangan itu.
Senyum Sofyan pun melebar. Langkahnya mantap keluar dari rumah tahanan KPK yang dihuninya sejak 27 Mei 2019.
Lantas, kasus apa sebenarnya yang membuat Sofyan terjerat hingga akhirnya terbebaskan itu?
text:
KPK Demands Not Work for Sofyan
Nov 04 2019, 21:03 by Tim detikcom
Jakarta - Sofyan Basir's two hands looked up while saying a prayer. The verdict is free from the hammer of a judge who is Sofyan damba.
"Once again I thank God, the government, and all those who helped this process so that they are free," Sofyan said after reading his verdict.
The former Director of PT PLN escaped the demands of the KPK prosecutor. In the suit sheet, the prosecutor asked the panel of judges to sentence Sofyan to 5 years in prison and a fine of Rp 200 million in 3 months imprisonment.
Sofyan's release surprised the prosecutors. But the opportunity to appeal the sentence still made prosecutors prosecutors.
"What is clear is that we studied the judge's decision first and then stated his attitude," said Ronald Ferdinand Worotikan as one of the prosecutors who served in the trial.
Sofyan's smile widened. His steps are steady out of the KPK detention house which he has been inhabiting since May 27, 2019.
So, what is the case that actually made Sofyan trapped until finally released?
